proficiency: and your choice of Intelligence or Charisma

(a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}

classFeature.name: Leadership Ability Score
entries: Some of your features reference your leadership ability score. It represents how you command the respect and loyalty of those around you, as well as how you lead them in battle. Perhaps you are an experienced veteran, survivor of dozens of military conflicts both large and small, a cunning tactician with an academic background in the study of warfare, or a driven idealist with a larger-than-life personality.
Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. The chosen ability score becomes your leadership ability score.

classFeature.name: Field Commander
entries: You learn how to become the centerpiece of a fighting unit and direct others to fight more effectively. Choose an ally within 60 feet that can see or hear you and isn't incapacitated and select one of the options below. You can use any number of the listed options on the same ally or divide them up between multiple allies.

items: On your turn, you can use your bonus action to give the target an additional bonus action on their next turn. Alternatively, the target can use its reaction to use this bonus action immediately.
You can use your reaction to give the target an additional reaction until the start of your next turn. This reaction cannot be used on the same turn as their normal reaction.

On your turn, you can subtract a multiple of 5 from your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and add the amount to the target's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} for its next turn. The amount of {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} the target gains in this manner cannot be higher than its base {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. This feature has no effect on a target whose {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is currently 0. You can choose multiple targets. If you do so, you have to divide the amount you subtract among the targets in multiples of 5. Any one of the targets can choose to use their reaction to move up to the {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} gained in this manner immediately. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. If it does not use up all {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} gained in this manner, it loses the rest.

classFeature.name: Tactical Mind
entries: You add your leadership ability modifier to your initiative.

classFeature.name: Inspiring Surge
entries: You learn to inspire your allies to draw on their hidden reserves and keep fighting. As a bonus action, choose a number of allies equal to half your proficiency (rounded up) within 60 feet that can see or hear you and aren't incapacitated. A target can immediately spend a hit die as if it had taken a rest, gaining hit points as normal.

classFeature.name: Leadership Path
entries: You choose an archetype from the list available that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Mastery
entries: You gain the mastery benefits for two {@filter weapons|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;!light;!medium;!heavy} of your choice as well as an {@filter armor|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;light;medium;heavy} type (see {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Weapon Mastery|Ishiir} variant rules). You must be proficient in the chosen weapons and armor. If you possess the Unarmored Defense feature, you may {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir|choose it} in place of an armor type.
You can change your choices when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Concerted Attack
entries: You and your allies form a more effective fighting force. When you use the attack action on your turn, an ally of your choice within 60 feet that can see or hear you can use its reaction to make a weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Leadership Path feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Leadership Path.

classFeature.name: Improved Inspiring Surge
entries: You add your leadership ability modifier to the number of hitpoints targets regain from your Inspiring Surge.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Call to Arms
entries: If you are not incapacitated or surprised at the start of combat, you can add your leadership modifier to the initiative roll of all allies of your choice within 60 feet that can see or you and aren't incapacitated or surprised.

classFeature.name: Leadership Path feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Leadership Path.

classFeature.name: Veteran Field Commander
entries: When you give your bonus action or reaction to an ally, you can target two allies instead of one. You can do so only once per turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Improved Concerted Attack
entries: You can choose up to two allies for your Concerted Attack. Alternatively, you can choose to make two weapon attacks instead of one with your attack action.

classFeature.name: Leadership Path feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Leadership Path.

classFeature.name: Tactical Flexibility
entries: You can grant your allies attacks as per the Concerted Strike class feature even when you use your action for something other than the attack action.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Legendary Field Commander
entries: As an action, you can choose one ally within 60 feet of you that can see or hear you. That ally gains an additional action on their next turn. Alternatively, the target can take its reaction to use this action immediately.

classFeature.name: Leadership Path feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Leadership Path.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Finest Hour
entries: Your leadership can temporarily inspire your companions to transcend their limits. On your turn, choose an ally within 60 feet that can see or hear you and isn't incapacitated. That ally gains an additional turn immediately after your current one.
You cannot use this feature again until you have completed a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

subclassFeature.name: Formation Fighting
entries: While you are not incapacitated, allies within 5 ft of you have half-cover against weapon attacks and you add your leadership ability modifier to the damage roll of the first weapon attack they hit with on a turn. You can extend this benefit to allies that are farther than 5 ft away from you, as long as they are within 5 ft of an ally that already is under the effect of this feature and isn't incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Hold the Line
entries: While you are not incapacitated, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}s against allies that benefit from your Formation Fighting cannot have advantage. Additionally, you and all allies under the effect of your Formation Fighting add your leadership ability modifier to {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}s and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}s against being knocked prone, pushed, or otherwise forced to move.

subclassFeature.name: Contingency Plans
entries: As long as you are not incapacitated, you and allies within 60 feet that can see or hear you cannot be surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Strikes
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, all attacks granted to your allies through your Concerted Attack that target the same creature are made with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Outmaneuver
entries: After initiative has been rolled, but before the first turn of combat, you and all allies within 60 feet that can see or hear you can move up to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} without provoking opportunity attacks. This feature has no effect if you're incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. You learn an additional cleric cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Crusader Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter cleric spells|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell bless|Ishiir} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell bless|Ishiir} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level cleric spells of your choice.

The Spells Known column of the Crusader Spellcasting table shows when you learn more cleric spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the cleric spells you know with another spell of your choice from the cleric spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Your leadership ability modifier is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells. You use your leadership ability modifier whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your leadership ability modifier when setting the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DC for a cleric spell you cast and when making an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with one.

subclassFeature.name: Armor of Faith
entries: You can target yourself with your Inspiring Surge. When you affect a creature with your Inspiring Surge and the target regains hitpoints in excess of its hitpoint maximum, it gains the difference as temporary hitpoints.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Arms
entries: You learn the Sanctified Strike cantrip if you do not know it already. Additionally, you can cast Sanctified Strike in place of one attack when you take the attack action.

subclassFeature.name: Smite Infidel
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can mark that creature until the end of your next turn. The first attack that hits the marked creature deals additional radiant damage equal to half your warlord level (rounded down) + your leadership ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Litany of Purgation
entries: When a creature is affected by your Inspiring Surge, it can immediately repeat a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against one on-going effect on it that normally allows for repeated {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}s at the end of its turn. If it spends an additional hit die, it can make this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} with advantage. The target does not regain additional hitpoints from spending this additional hit die.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of Faith
entries: Any creature that currently has temporary hitpoints from your Armor of Faith, is also considered to be under the effect of the {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Resilience
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 3 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

Additionally, allies within 60 feet that can see or you, take reduced damage from bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while you are not incapacitated. The reduction is equal to your leadership ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Warcry
entries: When your allies are affected by your Inspiring Surge, you can choose to apply one of the following additional effects per ally:

items: The target has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the start of your next turn.
The target's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is doubled until the start of your next turn.
The target has advantage on melee weapon {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}s until the start of your next turn, but {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}s against it also have advantage for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Shout
entries: As an action, you force all hostile creatures within 60 feet that can hear you to make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, a target deals half damage on its weapon attacks that hit until the start of your next turn.
This feature has no effect against creatures that are immune to the frightened condition.

subclassFeature.name: Thrill of Victory
entries: When an ally that you can see within 60 ft of you and that can see or hear you, reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, it can immediately regain a hit die. This feature has no effect if you're incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Defy Death
entries: If an ally that is currently affected by your Warcry is reduced to 0 hitpoints but not killed outright, it can spend hit dice up to a number equal to your leadership ability modifier as if it had taken a rest. Any excess damage from the instance of damage that reduced the ally to 0 hitpoints is then subtracted from the regained hitpoints.

subclassFeature.name: Inspired Ferocity
entries: When an ally that is currently affected by your Warcry lands a critical hit, it deals additional damage equal to half your warlord level (rounded down) + your leadership ability modifier.
